Detailed Description

General controller code for labels.

Subclass of NSArrayController. Contains all the labels, ensures no duplicate names and provides a "no-label" label. Upon insertion of a new object, name is checked for conflict. Will append a non-conflicting number if problems arise, e.g. "New Label" -> "New Label 1".

Member Function Documentation

- (id) newObject   [implementation]

Creates a new object.

Sets up new name to hard-coded "New Label" (to fix)

- (void) prepareContent   [implementation]

Prepares the content of the controller.

Sets up the noLabel object, updates the used names.

- (void) setupNoLabelObject   [implementation]

Initialization of the "no-label" object.

This object is unique for each document

- (NSString *) uniqueNewName: (NSString *)  newDesiredName   [implementation]

Generates a non-conflicting name from given name.

Returns a new name from the given so that no conflict arises inserting a new label with that name. Appends a number after the name if already exists.

Parameters:
newDesiredName String containing the desired name of the label.
Returns:
Same or modified name depending on if conflict was found.

- (void) updateUsedNames   [implementation]

Update the dictionary of used names to reflect current state.

Used when change is done on controlled objects. Costly operation, uses fetch in CoreData store to retrieve names.

- (void) validatesNewLabelName: (NSNotification *)  aNotification   [implementation]

Sets the name of the label in the notification to avoid conflicts.

This function changes the name of the label in the notification if there is a duplicate with existing labels.

Parameters:
aNotification NSNotification containing the new label as object.
See also:
- uniqueNewName:

Property Documentation

- (ZXLabelMO *) noLabel [read, write, retain]

Unique "no-label" label.

New transactions will automatically be assigned a "no-label" value. The name of this label is actually "-", and is hard-coded.

- (NSMutableDictionary *) usedNames [read, write, retain]

Dictionary of used names.

Variable used to check quickly for conflicts. As label names are unique, they are stored as dictionary keys, ensuring no duplicates.
